description: A very compact, folded SMG.  Made from steel, it's shaped like a box, compact enough to fit your pocket.

A delayed blowback operated, prototype assault rifle.  The CEAM Modèle 1 was developed from the StG 45(M), also using the 7.92x33mm Kurz round.  Later chambered for .30 Carbine ammo, the weapon was never deployed, with the development cancelled due economic reasons.

variants.description: A delayed blowback operated, prototype assault rifle.  The CEAM Modèle 1949 was the second CEAM prototype, developed from the StG 45(M).  The weapon was never deployed, with the development cancelled due economic reasons.

A delayed blowback operated, prototype assault rifle.  The CEAM Modèle II was the third CEAM prototype, developed from the StG 45(M).  The weapon was never deployed, with the development cancelled due economic reasons.

A delayed blowback operated, prototype assault rifle.  The CEAM Modèle 1950 was the last CEAM prototype, developed from the StG 45(M).  The weapon was never deployed, with the development cancelled due economic reasons.

description: A prototype that never saw light of day, the '90s IDW is (would've been) the smallest SMG in the world.  Made from machined steel, the weapon is heavier than it looks.  Using 9mm Parabellum bullets, it was supposed to be highly customizable, allowing attachments for the stock, sights, barrels, and even a bipod.  It also featured an electronic control mechanism to regulate the rate of fire to automatically limit the recoil.
//: This is a hybrid between the finished PDW prototype and the manufactured IDW
//2: Data obtained from http //firearmsworld.net/britain/phidw/idw.htm . Some values are approximates, such as the volume.

description: A famous bolt-action, internal magazine rifle.  Derived from the Standardmodell and Gewehr 98, the Kar98 inherited the well stablished, yet even more optimized Mauser action on a carbine design, fully Versailles '19 compliant.
//: This supposedly has between 2 and 4 moa, but that's way too much compared to the mosin91_30 value

variants.description: A famous bolt-action, internal magazine rifle.  The Kriegsmodell received some updates over the original version, such as removing the bayonet attachment, a simplified Mauser action, among other minor changes.

description: A semi-automatic .30-06 battle rifle, developed to compete after the M1 Garand entered production.  While it presented some advantages over its competitor, such as increased ammo capacity and the use of recoil to cycle, it's several minor disadvantages were enough to make the switch.
//: Virtually the same as a M1, very slightly worse specs (except for min_cycle_recoil), improved ammo capacity

description: A gas-operated, semi-auto Serbian DMR, based on the Soviet SVD-63.  Created to fulfill the (then novel) role as its spiritual predecesor, it was first deployed during the Yugoslav Wars.  Unlike the SVD however, the M76 is actually based on the AK design, overhauled to fit the bigger 7.92x57mm Mauser.
//: Accuracy is typically around 1.5 MOA, which is good for a Kalashnikov design and entirely acceptable for the designated marksman role.
//2: The dispersion at 900 m (984 yd) is described as 50 × 50 cm (19.7 × 19.7 in), which is ≈ 2.2 MOA.

variants.description: A gas-operated, semi-auto Serbian DMR, based on the Soviet SVD-63.  Created to fulfill the (then novel) role as its spiritual predecesor, it was first deployed during the Yugoslav Wars.  Unlike the SVD however, the M76 is actually based on the AK design, overhauled to fit the bigger 7.92x57mm Mauser.  This is the sporting rifle variant.
A gas-operated, semi-auto DMR, based on the Serbian M76 Zastava.  This is a variant, assembled locally and with new, modern parts.

description: A good old reliable, modernized to '00s standards by making use of the 1891/30 surplus.  The weapon received several upgrades and changes over the original: a modern stock, integrated bipod, action replacement, side rail for sights, wooden cheek pad, and an integrated flash hider.  The OTs-48 is sold as a hunting weapon.

A good old reliable, modernized to '00s standards by making use of the 1891/30 surplus.  The weapon received several upgrades and changes over the original: a modern stock, bullpup configuration for the action mechanism, custom pistol grip, side rail for sights, wooden cheek pad, and an underbarrel mount for bipods.  The OTs-48K is sold on order only, for the military.
//3: There's basically no reliable data about these, so most is copied over from the mosin91_30

description: A gas-operated, bolt action sniper and anti-materiel rifle.  Tested in 1994 for use in the Yugoslav wars, the revised version was modified to fit .50 BMG ammo, thus the II designation.  It features an integrated muzzle brake, which greatly reduces the recoil of the powerful ammo, a special alloy for the barrel which dramatically increases its durability to thousands of shots, and a wooden finishing for the stock and handling.
//2: Supposedly it has sub-moa groups at 1700 meters with very good ammo

description: A double action revolver carbine.  The action system can be manually cooked, and the cylinder holds nine rounds.  The weight of the wooden stock and the wooden handguard greatly increases recoil control.  There's engraving on the top strap, reading "EJERCITO MEXICANO", the end of the receiver is signed "H. PIEPER Bte LIEGE".
Also known as SG 550, this weapon is a selective fire automatic rifle designed for the Swiss military.  This is an old iteration of the 550 series, heavier and bulkier.

For reference, M16 has 10 shot group dispersion of 32 cm @ 300 m (calculated ~3.84 moa), AK-47 has 10 shot dispersion of 44 cm @ 300 m (calculated ~5.28 moa)), AK-74 has a R50 of 24 cm @ 300 m ( 24*2*0.937 ≈ 45 cm = 5.4 moa). description: Also known as SG 550-1, this weapon is a selective fire automatic rifle designed for the Swiss military.  This version has an integrated cheek pad, ergonomic pistol grip, and comes with a SUSAT scope.

A bolt-action, internal magazine rifle.  Developed at the end of the 19th century for the Spanish Army, it quickly became stablished and used in several fronts.  Its quality and early success led to the development of the Gewehr 98 and the M1903 Springfield, by proxy.
//: 3.25 in (8.255 cm) grouping at 100 yd (91.44 m) ~ 3.25 moa
//2: That's too much so I'm setting it at the same value of the mosin91_30

description: The SR-3MP is a gas-operated, compact, subsonic assault rifle.  Belongs to the "spetsialnaya" group, which includes weapons such as the VSK-94 and the VSS.  The SR-3MP was intended to serve as a compact replacement for the AS Val: shorter, without the integrated supressor and featuring a folding stock, the weapon is prepared for concealed carry and urban combat.  Uses 9x39mm ammo.
//: 9x39 damage is too low, so I'm increasing it a bit here and with the ammo

variants.description: The SR-3M is a gas-operated, compact, subsonic assault rifle.  Belongs to the "spetsialnaya" group, which includes weapons such as the VSK-94 and the VSS.  The SR-3M is an older variant of the SR-3MP, lacking the extra rails.  Uses 9x39mm ammo.

description: The Sturmgewehr 44 or Maschinenpistole 43 (depending on who you ask) was among the first "assault rifles" ever created, and the first successful one.  Gas-operated and featuring selective fire, it used the intermediate 7.92x33mm Kurz cartridge, having the goal to give soldiers enough firepower for mid-range engagements.  A timeless classic, you'd be the envy of the breathing post-Cataclysm weapon collectors.
//2: though the report accepted that its accuracy was 'excellent for a weapon of its type'
//3: Assuming this means more than less 3 moa due being an early 'assault rifle', and modern 'assault rifles' having ~3 moa

description: A famous semi-auto, gas-operated, Soviet era DMR, using the old, trusty 7.62x54mmR, easily recognizable by the shape of the stock.  Widely known around the world with more than half a century of service, it has enough field testing to prove its reliability and effectiveness.
//: When using standard grade 57-N-323S cartridges, the accuracy of the SVD is reduced to 2.21 MOA extreme vertical spread. The extreme vertical spreads for the SVD are established by shooting 5-shot groups at 300 m range.

variants.description: A famous semi-auto, gas-operated, Soviet era DMR, using the old, trusty 7.62x54mmR, easily recognizable by the shape of the stock.  This is the civilian, full barrel length variant, compliant with the National Firearms Act.

description: A break action, single shot pistol.  Highly customizable, the weapon design is fundamentally modular: the barrel can be removed and replaced for another with a different caliber, the hammer can be switched between rimfire or centerfire modes, and the adjustable trigger allows using a heavy pull or a hair trigger pull.
//: The CCI Velocitor is a hunting load that often demonstrates good accuracy. A three shot 25-yard group yielded a 1.5-inch group. Moving to the unplated CCI SGB (Small Game Bullet) the Contender exhibited a 1.25-inch group. The CCI Mini Mag, a great hunting load with good all around performance, was good for 1.1 inches.

description: A retrofuturistic-looking, gas-operated, bullpup assault rifle, featuring a bakelite case.  Created in the early '60s and featuring a bakelite case, the weapon was intended to serve as a smaller, portable replacement to the AKM.  Some issues, like the shifted center of gravity, the bakelite's durability, and the radical appearance, were enough for its rejection.

A retrofuturistic-looking, gas-operated, bullpup assault rifle.  Created in the early '60s and featuring a bakelite case, the weapon was intended to serve as a smaller, portable replacement to the AKM.  Some issues, like the center of gravity (shifted by the extreme magazine position), the bakelite's durability, and the radical appearance, were enough for its rejection
//: Hybrid between fn_p90 and ak47. Values I couldn't find, like dispersion, ammo, etc were copied from the ak47

description: The VSS is a compact, subsonic Soviet DMR featuring an integrated supressor and PSO-1 scope.  Designed alongside other "spetsialnaya" group Soviet era weapons such as the AS Val and the OTs-14 "Groza", in order to replace general use weapons, such as the AK-74.  Ironically enough, the Vintorez also lacks a niche: it can be used in stealth operations, as marksman rifle, as a pseudo-SMG, and as general use "assault weapon".  The only downsides are the relative low effective range and the pronunciated bullet drop, both due the properties of the 9x39mm.
//: We did not have the facilities at this time to measure group size, although we understand that the accuracy is excellent out to 150 meters and our observation indicated 1-2 MOA.
//3: 9x39 damage is too low, so I'm increasing it a bit here and with the ammo
//4: Ideally, the VSS should instead have increased crit chance and higher crit dmg modifier, to emulate the late-game scaling with proficiency

description: A gas-operated, semi-automatic bullpup sniper rifle.  The weapon was designed around reliability and precision, having a floating barrel, bullpup design to reduce total size, no iron sights, an integrated half flash-hider half compensator attachment, and an adjustable recoil dampening system.  One of the rarest weapons ever made.
